What is the knowledge of vows?
Answer: It is like an arhat who has attained spiritual powers and mastery of the mind.
According to his desire to know the meaning, he makes a correct vow.
Then he enters the fourth dhyÄna of the limit.
After arising from concentration, he knows everything according to his vow.
As for knowing the meaning according to one's desire,
why does the arhat wish to know the meaning?
Answer: For three reasons.
First, for the sake of benefiting disciples.
Second, for the sake of upholding the Buddha's teachings.
Third, for the sake of knowing the peace and unrest of the world.
As for benefiting disciples,
it means that when the arhats' disciples cultivate contemplation,
it is the Dharma to observe how long it has been since they entered the holy path.
When my life ends, can so-and-so enter the correct state of detachment from birth or not?
If they cannot enter, after my life ends,
can others teach them to enter or not?
In this way, they know through the knowledge of vows.
These are called benefiting disciples.
As for upholding the Buddha's teachings,
It means when an arhat is engaged in activities related to stupas, monasteries, and Buddhist monasteries for the sake of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha,
the Dharma requires them to examine whether it can be accomplished in a short or long time.
For the rest of their life, can they accomplish it?ğŸ”½If they cannot accomplish it,
after their death, will there be other people who can continue to accomplish it?
Or there may be kings, ministers, elders, and merchants who wish to cause harm to the Buddha's teachings.
There may be arhats who wish to transform them.
They then examine whether they can be transformed.
If they can be transformed, how long will it take?
For the rest of their life, can they accomplish the transformation?
If they cannot accomplish it, after their death, will there be others who can continue it?
All of these are known through the knowledge of vows.
These kinds of things are called upholding the Buddha's teachings.
Knowing whether the world is at peace or not at peace means
that arhats sometimes examine the countries and times in which they are located.
There will be matters of abundance and scarcity, fear and peace, and epidemics, etc.
In order to make oneself and others know and abandon [these matters], one gives rise to the knowledge of vows and knows [them].
In the past, in this country of Kashmira, there was a king named Shakya.
The king of the country of Baka invaded the territory and took it away.
At that time, King Shakya then led troops and soldiers, wanting to engage in battle.
That king's nature was compassionate and he was always afraid of evil karma.
He secretly thought like this.
He did not know whether he would certainly win the battle and keep his kingly position.
If he did not succeed, he would kill the people in vain.
He would incur more misfortune and sin, and after death he would fall into hell.
He had heard that in a certain monastery,
there was an arhat who had attained the wonderful knowledge of vows.
He should go and ask [him].
Having thought this, he immediately went there.
He returned to his sincerity, made obeisance, and asked to resolve his doubts.
That arhat then answered the king, saying,
Although I have attained this knowledge, the conditions for support are lacking, so

Question: What is the nature of the knowledge of vows?
Answer: Its nature is wisdom.
Just as I is the nature, characteristics, and essence of my possessions, so is it.
The nature has already been explained.

Answer: Because it can know according to the vow, it is called the knowledge of vows.
